trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey"></xref> class defines the type of the identifier of a subject, such as a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsSigner"></xref> or a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.CmsRecipient"></xref>.
The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type"></xref> property retrieves the type of subject identifier or key.
The subject can be identified by the certificate issuer and serial number, the hash of the subject key, or the subject key.
A member of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKeyType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the type of subject identifier.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Value"></xref> property retrieves the value of the subject identifier or key.

Use the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type"></xref> property to determine the type of subject identifier or key, and use the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Value"></xref> property to retrieve the corresponding value.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> object that represents the value of the subject identifier or key.
This <xref href="System.Object"></xref> can be one of the following objects as determined by the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifierOrKey.Type"></xref> property.
